content.description: An evolutionary biologist hypothesizes that two morphologically similar plant species are not closely related. To test the hypothesis, the biologist collects <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> samples from each of the two plant species and then uses restriction enzymes to cut the <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> samples into fragments, which are then subjected to gel electrophoresis. The results are shown in Figure 1.
content.question: Figure 1. <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> analysis of two species Given the results shown in Figure 1, which of the following correctly explains a relationship between the two species?

choices.label: Species <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the ancestor of species <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because it has fewer bands.

Species <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is more complex than species <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> because it has more bands.

Species <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> has more short fragments of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> than species <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does.

Species <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has more short fragments of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> than species <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> does.

content.answer: Species <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> has more short fragments of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> than species <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does.

skill.text: 6.D: Explain the relationship between experimental results and larger biological concepts, processes, or theories.
